rename.from: class index out of range during validation of training
rename.to: Expected all tensors to be on the same device, but found at least two devices, cuda:0 and cpu!

body:
@ardeal you do not need to modify any part of the code to train custom datasets, you simply need to point to a proper dataset yaml file. See custom data training tutorial:
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5/wiki/Train-Custom-Data

@glenn-jocher ,
Hi,
Thank you for your reply!

I exactly followed the section "Train-Custom-Data". however, during the validation of the training, the output of the network is not 0-3 but 0-79.

so, I modified yolov3.cfg to modify the classes=4. however, I encountered a new issue as above.

@ardeal archive branch is no longer maintained, I would recommend using master branch. Good luck in your endeavors.

BRANCH NOTICE: The [ultralytics/yolov3](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3) repository is now divided into two branches:
* [Master branch](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/tree/master): Forward-compatible with all [YOLOv5](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov5) models and methods (**recommended**).
```bash
$ git clone https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3  # master branch (default)
```
* [Archive branch](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/tree/archive): Backwards-compatible with original [darknet](https://pjreddie.com/darknet/) *.cfg models (⚠️ no longer maintained). 
```bash
$ git clone -b archive https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3  # archive branch
```

@glenn-jocher ,
Hi,
Thanks!

I would like to use master branch which is the latest version. however, I tried to run it on my 3060Ti GPU. Even if I set batch-size=2, I encountered very weird issue. it might because that much less GPU memory when I searched the issue on google.

@ardeal CUDA memory requirements should be roughly similar between the two branches. You may need a larger GPU though to obtain higher batch sizes, as low batch sizes will reduce performance (less statistics for the batchnorm2d() layers).

@ardeal no code changes are required for training custom data. See custom data training tutorial here, it's really easy.
https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data

@glenn-jocher , Many thanks for your kind help! I will follow that section and try master branch again. for archive branch, I still have questions. see the following code which is copied from YOLOLayer class in models.py file. tensor p is reshaped. p = p.view(bs, self.na, self.no, self.ny, self.nx).permute(0, 1, 3, 4, 2).contiguous() # prediction the above code means that self.na * self.no must be 255, otherwise, there is error. ```Python def forward(self, p, out): ASFF = False # https://arxiv.org/abs/1911.09516 if ASFF: i, n = self.index, self.nl # index in layers, number of layers p = out[self.layers[i]] bs, _, ny, nx = p.shape # bs, 255, 13, 13 if (self.nx, self.ny) != (nx, ny): self.create_grids((nx, ny), p.device) # outputs and weights # w = F.softmax(p[:, -n:], 1) # normalized weights w = torch.sigmoid(p[:, -n:]) * (2 / n) # sigmoid weights (faster) # w = w / w.sum(1).unsqueeze(1) # normalize across layer dimension # weighted ASFF sum p = out[self.layers[i]][:, :-n] * w[:, i:i + 1] for j in range(n): if j != i: p += w[:, j:j + 1] * \ F.interpolate(out[self.layers[j]][:, :-n], size=[ny, nx], mode='bilinear', align_corners=False) elif ONNX_EXPORT: bs = 1 # batch size else: bs, _, ny, nx = p.shape # bs, 255, 13, 13 if (self.nx, self.ny) != (nx, ny): self.create_grids((nx, ny), p.device) # p.view(bs, 255, 13, 13) -- > (bs, 3, 13, 13, 85) # (bs, anchors, grid, grid, classes + xywh) p = p.view(bs, self.na, self.no, self.ny, self.nx).permute(0, 1, 3, 4, 2).contiguous() # prediction if self.training: return p ```
There's at least one reason to use the archive branch: it has a weight converter.  I personally need that in order to transform my learned model to run quickly in OpenVINO.
